Datasets

Source: R/datasets.R
alcohol.Rd

alcohol, chlamydiae and age datasets

alcohol

chlamydiae

age

Format

A list containing

X

the normalized OTU data,

Y

the alcohol intake phenotype,

tree

the corresponding phylogenetic tree,

taxonomy

the taxonomic lineages of the OTUs.

Source

Wu, Gary D., et al. "Linking long-term dietary patterns with gut microbial enterotypes." Science 334.6052 (2011): 105-108.

Caporaso, J. G., et al. (2011). "Global patterns of 16S rRNA diversity at a depth of millions of sequences per sample." PNAS, 108, 4516-4522. PMCID: PMC3063599

Brito, Ilana L., et al. "Mobile genes in the human microbiome are structured from global to individual scales." Nature 535.7612 (2016): 435-439.

Details

The alcohol dataset was taken from a study of the dietary association with the gut microbiome (Wu, 2011). Here we include the alcohol intake as the primary phenotype. The OTU abundance data consists of 98 samples with 949 OTUs with prevalence > 10 normalized to account for variable library sizes.

The chlamydia dataset is taken from a 16s rRNA diversity study narrowed to the Chlamydiae bacteria taxon, originally appearing in PNAS.

The age dataset comes from Brito et al. (2016)
